definition: (to go to) distant parts/faraway/a distant relative
to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
near and distant relatives

sentences.english: Later that morning, Werther informed the servant that he would be going on a trip.
sentences.chinese: 那个上午晚些时候，维特告诉仆人说他要出远门。

sentences.english: Helen is anxious about travelling on her own.
sentences.chinese: 海伦对自己一个人出远门旅行感到担心。

sentences.english: Octogene Chen is Taiwan's farmers, has never been too far out the door.
sentences.chinese: 陈阿土是台湾的农民，从来没有出过远门。

sentences.english: One day, their father Mr Earnshaw came back from a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他们的父亲欧肖先生出远门回来。

sentences.english: They ran it when he was away, for example.
sentences.chinese: 比如，丈夫出远门时，妻子照料家庭。

sentences.english: They might not plan big trips or try something risky.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能都不会出远门，或是试图做有风险的事。

sentences.english: Internet penetration is rising in developing countries and emerging markets. online retailers allow consumers to shop without taking a trip.
sentences.chinese: 在线零售商允许消费者不用出远门就可以购物。

sentences.english: I want to accompany her a short distance.
sentences.chinese: 她头一次出远门，我想伴送一程。

sentences.english: Or maybe you're going to go away and you want a neighbour to water your plants.
sentences.chinese: 或者，你因为要出远门而需要邻居给你养的植物浇水。

sentences.english: One day he went on a long trip alone.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他要独自出趟远门。

sentences.english: I get the house all shipshape while he is away.
sentences.chinese: 他出远门时，我把房子收拾得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: The first time Xiao Ming left home alone, his mother was very worried.
sentences.chinese: 第一次独自出远门，妈妈还真有些难以放怀。

sentences.english: The Chongqing citizens don't have to trip far away for their luxurious home then.
sentences.chinese: 重庆市民终于可以不用再出远门去买奢侈家居了。

sentences.english: He abandoned his desolate home and set out on a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 他抛弃了荒芜的家园，出远门去了。

definition: to pass through a doorway/(of a woman) to marry/orchestral music interlude in an opera
old variant of 趟[tang1]
classifier for times, round trips or rows/a time/a trip
to wade/to trample/to turn the soil
branch road/setback/accident/hiccup
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to take the car, bus, train etc
house door/family clan
a long journey/far from home
to go on an official or business trip
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
what?/which?
to go out/to leave for another place
countryside/rural area/CL:個|个[ge4]
to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
native place/place of origin/home state or region
to visit one's parents
long-distance/long-haul
